meanings.definition: To make something into a commercial product or service for sale.
meanings.sent1: The local artist commercialized her paintings by selling them at the market.
meanings.sent2: Many companies commercialized their products to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: The idea of commercialized cupcakes made the children excited for the bake sale.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for commercializing handmade crafts turned her hobby into a successful business.
meanings.sent5: The town fair was a showcase of commercialized goods from various vendors.

meanings.sent1: Some businesses commercialize the environment without considering the consequences.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to commercialize the latest trend to increase their revenue.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon tried to commercialize the situation by selling stolen goods.
meanings.sent4: She realized her boss was trying to commercialize her skills for his benefit.
meanings.sent5: The greedy merchant always looked for ways to commercialize any opportunity for personal gain.

meanings.definition: To adapt something for commercial purposes.
meanings.sent1: The company had to commercialize their website to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: The film director had to commercialize the script to appeal to a broader audience.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to commercialize the recipe to meet the demands of the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: He had to commercialize his artwork to make a living as an artist.
meanings.sent5: The designer had to commercialize the fashion line to compete in the market.
